alert.note: Alert for Newaygo (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 07 at 12:41PM EDT until April 12 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Muskegon River at Newaygo affecting Newaygo County. Muskegon River at Bridgeton affecting Newaygo County. .Three quarters of an inch has fallen basin wide and is making its way through the rivers. Water levels will be rising again over the next few days. Depending on how quickly this water moves through the dams, it`s possible we may exceed minor flood stage at Newaygo and Bridgeton later this week. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Muskegon River at Newaygo. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, The river starts exceeding its banks and minor flooding begins in low lying areas along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 10.8 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached late Friday into Saturday. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr.
